Act5Scene7.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene7.text: What's he that was not born of woman? Such a one am I to fear, or none.
Act5Scene7.translation: Where is the man who wasn't born from a woman. He is the only one I fear.

Act5Scene7.speaker: Young Siward
Act5Scene7.text: The devil himself could not pronounce a title more hateful to mine ear.

Act5Scene7.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene7.translation: No, nor could the devil's name be more frightening.

Act5Scene7.speaker: Young Siward
Act5Scene7.text: Thou liest, abhorrèd tyrant. With my sword I’ll prove the lie thou speak’st.

Act5Scene7.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene7.text: Thou wast born of woman. But swords I smile at, weapons laugh to scorn, Brandished by man that’s of a woman born.
Act5Scene7.translation: You were born from a woman. I mock any weapon held by a man born from a woman.
